item.title: Alex Cayco Gajic
item.description: I am a junior professor at the Group for Neural Theory at Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure in Paris . I am interested in how different brain regions coordinate for flexible motor control. Training : I received a PhD in applied mathematics at the University of Washington in Seattle (in Eric Shea Brown’s lab) where my dissertation focused on how correlated neural activity impacts population coding. I then joined Angus Silver’s lab in University College London to study the cerebellum and get my hands dirty with large-scale data analysis.
